transportAdvice: Málaga's historic centre and seafront are very walkable, with most major attractions reachable on foot. The city also has a metro line, an extensive bus network, and taxis are readily available throughout tourist areas.

weather.description: Mild winter days with occasional rain showers and cool evenings, but generally pleasant for sightseeing.
Similar to January with slightly warmer afternoons and a mix of sunny spells and rainy days.
Spring begins with warming temperatures and a fair amount of sunshine, though showers remain possible.
Pleasantly warm and increasingly sunny, making it a comfortable month for outdoor exploration.
Warm and largely dry with long sunny days, ideal for beach visits and city walks.
Hot and reliably sunny with very little rain, marking the start of peak beach season.
Very hot and almost entirely dry, with intense midday sun best avoided by seeking shade or the sea.
Peak summer heat continues with crowded beaches and long warm evenings perfect for outdoor dining.
Still warm and mostly sunny with the sea at its warmest, and slightly fewer crowds than August.
Comfortable autumn temperatures with more frequent rain returning, but still many fine days.
Noticeably cooler with a higher chance of rain, though mild enough for comfortable city exploration.
Cool and occasionally wet winter weather, but festive atmosphere and far fewer tourists than summer.
